elements.title: Ahmad Shah Durrani (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ahmad Shah Durrani (pictured) conducted fifteen major military campaigns during his reign, comprising nine invasions of India, three in Khorasan, and three in Afghan Turkestan?

elements.title: Zenkoku Jiren (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, when workers of the Zenkoku Jiren went on strike at a Hitachi factory, anarchist militants firebombed the mansion of Hitachi's president, Namihei Odaira?

elements.title: Matilda Freeman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Matilda Freeman did not originally intend to be an actress, but auditioned for a role after being teased by some classmates?

elements.title: New Tide (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New Tide was abandoned after many of its contributors left the country or joined the Chinese Literary Association?

elements.title: 2014 Louisville, Mississippi tornado (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2014 Louisville, Mississippi tornado was powerful enough that an entire door was torn off and blown 30 miles (48 km)?

elements.title: a park in New York City (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a park in New York City occupies the former site of a waste transfer station and a heliport?

elements.title: James Mange (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that reggae musician James Mange formed a soccer-themed political party to compete in South Africa's first democratic election?

elements.title: Queen's Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Queen's Theatre in East London was named to reflect its opening in the same year as the coronation of Elizabeth II?

elements.title: the Boshfather (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "the Boshfather" was deported from Australia in October 2025?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
